esp:page.esp:title: About Oracc: Essentials for Oracc users

body.p: Oracc makes much of its data available in JSON format, and more JSON data is planned. All Oracc JSON files consist of a single object which have a "type" member and, in the case of project data, a "project" member. The data structure for each type is described here.

Two files are provided at the top level: a simple list of public projects (projects.json) and a complex list of public projects analogous to the one-page listing of projects with blurbs (projectlist.json). In each case, these can be retrieved by prefixing them with an Oracc server name, e.g., http://oracc.org/projects.json or http://oracc.museum.upenn.edu/projects.json.

dl.dd: Provides a simple list of project names which can be concatenated to an Oracc server name to provide the base URL for retrieving additional JSON objects.
Provides a version of the data used in the project list at http://oracc.org/projectlist.html.
